alert.note: Alert for Northwest Deserts (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 3:01PM MST until February 23 at 5:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TUESDAY TO 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 3000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Northwest Deserts including Kingman. * WHEN...From 11 AM Tuesday to 5 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions and travel delays on Interstate 40 from Kingman and east to the county line. City and county roads could have increased accidents due to slick, snowy roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Greatest concern for impacts will be along Interstate 40 east of Fort Rock where 3 to 5 inches will be possible. This could result in accidents and possible significant travel delays on Interstate 40.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Expect snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
